item.description:
We decided to move on to Leibniz's reply to Locke's Essay Concerning Human Understanding. His work is: New Essays on Human Understanding. Since this is a bit of fast change and many of us probably didn't have time to get the book, there is no assigned reading for now. As the meeting approaches there may be some suggestions where or which part of the work start with. Please e-mail your ideas and internet resources that you are aware of about this work. As always there are certainly internet resources available about Locke and Leibniz. Our usual suspects are:

Standford encyclopedia:
http://plato.stanford...
Philosophy pages
http://www.philosophy...
Internet encyclopedia of philosophy:
http://www.utm.edu/re...

On the second web site there is a nice analysis of Locke's essay:
http://www.philosophy...

Additional info:
Leibniz's essay is available on line at google books:
http://books.google.c...

Besides the New Essays On Human Understanding it also has 4-5 shorter essays of Leibniz about Locke. For our meeting next Thursday (7th April) let's cover the first book: Innate Ideas (of the New Essays On Human Understanding). This is shorter (32 pages) so there may be opportunity to read about Leibniz and his life or his other short essays about Locke in this book.
item.name: Leibniz: New Essays on Human Understanding
